clinical_study.brief_title: Platelet-rich Plasma for Chronic Lateral Ankle Instability
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Platelet-rich Plasma in the Treatment of Chronic Lateral Ankle Instability

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the effect of platelet-rich plasma (PRP) on chronic lateral ankle instability by comparing the imaging and clinical outcomes between patients receiving PRP and those receiving whole blood during the modified Broström-Gould procedure.

detailed_description.textblock: Chronic lateral ankle instability (CAI) in a common foot and ankle problem. It has been linked to recurrent ankle pain, swelling, and even early degenerative change if not properly treated. Lateral ligament reconstruction using modified Broström-Gould procedure is the mainstream in treatment of CAI. Early mobilization is related to better functional outcome, and rapid healing of the repair is the key point to shorten the immobilization time. Platelet-rich plasma (PRP) is a fraction of plasma that contains platelets and multiple growth factors concentrated at high level. Because activated platelets have the potential to release growth factors, PRP has been clinically used to accelerate wound healing and tissue regeneration. However, there is no conclusion regarding the efficacy of PRP on CAI. This clinical trial will investigate the effect of PRP on CAI. Eligible patients will be randomly assigned to receive PRP or whole blood during the modified Broström-Gould procedure. The postoperative imaging and clinical outcomes will be compared and analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: 3-month postoperative ankle function evaluated by AOFAS Ankle-Hindfoot score
primary_outcome.description: Ankle function is evaluated by AOFAS Ankle-Hindfoot score

secondary_outcome.measure: 3-month postoperative ankle pain evaluated by visual analogue scale
secondary_outcome.description: Ankle pain is evaluated by visual analogue scale

secondary_outcome.measure: 3-month postoperative anterior displacement of ankle evaluated by stress radiographs of anterior drawer test
secondary_outcome.description: Anterior displacement is evaluated by the anterior displacement of the talus relative to the tibia on stress radiographs of anterior drawer test.

secondary_outcome.measure: 3-month postoperative lateral tilt of ankle evaluated by stress radiographs of talar tilt test
secondary_outcome.description: Lateral tilt of ankle is evaluated by stress radiographs of talar tilt test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with healed ligament evaluated by MRI
secondary_outcome.description: Healing condition of ligament is assessed by MRI.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with healed ligament evaluated by second look arthroscopy
secondary_outcome.description: Healing condition of ligament is assessed by second look arthroscopy.

arm_group.description: 15 patients will receive platelet-rich plasma gel applied during the modified Broström-Gould procedure for reconstructing lateral ligament.
15 patients will receive whole blood applied during the modified Broström-Gould procedure for reconstructing lateral ligament.

intervention.description: Platelet-rich plasma gel applied during the modified Broström-Gould procedure for reconstructing lateral ligament
Whole blood applied during the modified Broström-Gould procedure for reconstructing lateral ligament

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 20 and 60 years
- With diagnosis of chronic lateral ankle instability
Exclusion Criteria:
- Poor controlled diabetes
- Peripheral artery obstructive disease
- Skin or soft tissue infection at ankle
- With current or prior history of ankle disease, including degeneration arthritis, fracture, deformity, and cartilage disease.
- With prior history of ankle surgery
- With current or prior history of cancer
- With current or prior history of hematological disease
- Pregnancy
